title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Telangana CM seeks defence land transfer for Gandhi Sarovar
items.summary: - The Telangana CM A. Revanth Reddy met Defence Minister Rajnath Singh in New Delhi and sought transfer of 98.20 acres of defence land in Hyderabad for the *Gandhi Sarovar Project*.\n- He outlined plans for a *Gandhi Circle of Unity* at the confluence of the Musi and Esa rivers and proposed components including a knowledge hub, meditation village, handloom centre, a public museum and a statue of peace.\n- Union Minister Nitin Gadkari assured sending an official team to Hyderabad to study the *greenfield road network* linking Bharat Future City to Bandaru Port, with a review on September 22 in Hyderabad.

items.title: United-Spirit clash over business model
items.summary: - United questioned Spirit's survival, calling the *ultra-low-cost* model an *interesting experiment* that has "failed".\n- Spirit fired back on X, praising its *low fares* and premium offerings, and quipping that United executives can't stop talking about them.\n- With Spirit's bankruptcy protections and network reductions, United moved to capture market share by selling tickets to 15 Spirit markets to offer customers options.

items.title: TSMC posts 33.8% YoY August revenue boost
items.summary:
- *TSMC's August 2025 consolidated revenue* reached NT$335.77 billion (US$10.41B), up 3.9% from July and 33.8% from August 2024.
- *January–August 2025 revenue* stood at NT$2.43 trillion (US$75.39B), up 37.1% YoY.
- *H1 2025 subsidies* total USD 2.23B from four governments, lifting total aid to USD 4.7B over 18 months.

items.title: India’s largest PCB facility in Andhra Pradesh
items.author: Samdani MN
items.summary:
- SSEPL will invest **₹1,076 crore** to set up PCB manufacturing and R&D in Naidupeta, creating 1,011 jobs.
- Together with two other Syrma projects—CCL facility (**₹417.78 crore**, 647 jobs) and EMS facility (**₹100 crore**, 510 jobs)—the total investment reaches **₹1,593 crore** and over 2,100 jobs.
- The AP **ECMS policy** provides incentives such as capital subsidies, power incentives, and land at concessional rates to boost electronics manufacturing and cut import dependence.

items.title: India, EU trade pact talks in fast lane: Goyal
items.summary:
- *Piyush Goyal* said talks on the proposed free trade agreement are progressing fast, with about 60–65% of chapters completed and a substantial conclusion possible by the EU commissioners' visit.
- The 13th round is under way in New Delhi as *Maros Sefcovic* and *Christophe Hansen* are expected to visit this week, signaling active convergence.
- He warned the steel sector against rushing to import cheaper material, urging protection of domestic producers and mindful use of *CBAM* to safeguard self-reliance.

items.title: Botanic Healthcare opens liposomal manufacturing facility in Hyderabad
Italian Navy PASSEX with INS Surat
items.summary:
- The *PASSEX* between Italy's Caio Duilio and India’s INS Surat occurred under the EU’s *Operation ASPIDES* in the Indian Ocean.
- It included manoeuvring drills, data exchanges, and simultaneous flight operations to boost *operational interoperability* and *maritime security*.
- The engagement strengthens India–Europe cooperation on freedom of navigation and strategic sea lanes, promoting regional stability.

items.title: Fertiliser ITC hit despite cheaper raw materials
items.author: Shambhavi Anand, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Subsidy-related price inversion keeps a large accumulation of *GST ITC* despite lower raw material costs.
- Industry urges a full refund of ITC and a clarification under *Section 54(3)* to enable refunds, easing *working capital* and funding capital projects.
- Although GST on fertilisers was cut to 5%, persisting cash-flow pressures threaten the supply chain and investment in the sector.

items.title: Homegrown, high-tech weapons: Army Chief
items.author: Manu Pubby, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The Army Chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi says *home-grown* weapons built via a triad of industry, academia and the military can counter superior adversaries using *low-cost, high-tech* solutions.
- He envisions extended ranges for loitering munitions to 750 km and rockets to 300 km, stressing rapid tech upgrades under *Aatmanirbhar* self-reliance.
- He cites a projected defence spend of about ₹3 lakh crore with 10% annual growth to spur a cross-domain *Aatmanirbhar* ecosystem delivering cutting-edge solutions.

items.title: Mexico seeks to impose tariffs on auto, manufacturing imports
items.summary:
- Mexico will propose a 2026 budget bill to impose tariffs on autos and some manufacturing imports to address trade imbalances and raise about 70 billion pesos ($3.76B) in state revenue.
- Lerma said the plan would follow international treaty rules, applying to countries without current trade agreements.
- Analysts warn tariffs could lift inflation, noting much of Mexico's industrial input comes from China, while the United States remains its main trading partner.

items.title: Boeing Defense strike enters sixth week with sides still at loggerheads
Tata Electronics builds wall to deter elephants in Assam
items.summary:
- Tata Electronics is building a **massive elephant-proof wall** around its upcoming OSAT plant in *Assam*, with government support to keep **elephants** from disrupting construction.
- The site also faces vibration and wildlife challenges, with rescuers capturing and relocating snakes to their habitat to prevent interference with precision chip assembly.
- The Rs 27,000 crore project, part of the *India Semiconductor Mission*, has potential customers like **Tesla**, signaling a major push for semiconductors in India.

items.title: Arm launches new generation of mobile chip designs geared for AI
DLI 2.0: Govt plans sops, local sourcing mandates to push chip demand
Sophos: AI use drives cybersecurity burnout in India 2025
items.summary:
- Sophos’ 5th APJ report finds *cybersecurity burnout* in India at 95% of organisations in 2025, up from 83% in 2024, driven by increased threat activity, board pressure, and alert overload. 
- AI has a two‑pronged effect: *AI-powered security tools* can relieve fatigue and speed incident response, while widespread **shadow AI** use by employees creates new risks and governance gaps. 
- Burnout is a business issue affecting productivity, incident response, and budgets; 87% offer counselling and 71% plan budget increases, underscoring the need for robust *AI governance* and clear usage boundaries.

items.title: Sterling & Wilson bags ₹415 cr solar order
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The order is a **300 MW AC/420 MWp** solar PV project in Rajasthan under a **BOS EPC** package, valued at ₹415 crore including *O&M* and taxes.
- SWREL is a global EPC player with over **22.8 GWp** portfolio and **9.3 GWp** O&M across 28 countries.
- Global CEO **Chandra Kishore Thakur** says the contract underscores strong execution; gross inflows surpassed ₹2,400 crore this year.

items.title: Volkswagen to invest up to a billion euros in AI by end of decade
ISA seeks govt help to cut steel input costs
items.summary:
- ISA is engaging with the government to reduce *input costs*, aiming to make *iron ore more affordable* so steel prices come down, per Secretary General Alok Sahay at the New Delhi Steel Conclave.
- He said external costs beyond the plant affect India’s steel competitiveness and noted government actions on *anti-dumping measures*, safeguard duties, and transition financing.
- The ISA projects steel demand growth of about *7–8% annually* (around 150 mt this year) and reaffirmed India’s commitment to *net zero by 2070*, while tariffs with the US remain unchanged.

items.title: GST exemption for flight, motion simulators to help reduce training costs: Civil Aviation Ministry
Semiconductor equipment billings in Taiwan to double this year: SEMI
CN Water plans to foray into semiconductor-grade water
At 17, iPhone debuts at India’s largest factory
Japanese delegation explores semiconductors in Dholera
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- A 20-company Japanese delegation, including **Shimizu Corporation**, visited Dholera SIR to explore opportunities in India's semiconductor sector and discussed pairing Japan's precision tech with India's scale to position Dholera as a semiconductor hub.
- They explored collaborations for precision facilities serving **Tata Semiconductor** and other fabs, plus warehouses, gas distribution, clean rooms, and joint skill development for semiconductor manufacturing.
- Dholera hosts India's largest fab (Tata Group–PSMC) worth ₹92,000 crore, slated to start production in 2027, with other Activation Zone projects and a 5 GW solar park expected to generate 1.5 lakh+ jobs by 2030; improved expressway and airport boost connectivity.

items.title: India to be a manufacturing powerhouse via R&D
items.summary:
- India's manufacturing sector must move beyond short-term disruptions by embracing *agility*, *innovation*, and *global partnerships*, per the VLFM convention in Mumbai.
- Leaders warn that *sustainability*, *technology*, and *AI* are permanent priorities, urging R&D spending to rise from 0.3% of GDP toward the global average of about *1.5%*.
- The India–Japan collaboration is a major opportunity, pairing *India's digital strength* with *Japan's manufacturing expertise* to build a resilient, high-value manufacturing ecosystem.

items.title: LNJ Bhilwara acquires Statkraft stake in hydropower projects
TCS partners with CEA to advance physical AI in France
Shyam Metalics expands into crash barrier manufacturing
Vedanta calls critical minerals key to India’s EV push
items.summary:
- *Vedanta* argues that its portfolio of *critical minerals* strengthens the supply chain for India's transition to *electric vehicles*. 
- The group plans more than ₹12,500 crore of capex to expand aluminium, zinc, ferrochrome and steel production to serve India's EV sector. 
- It also pledges alignment with *Atmanirbhar Bharat* and responsible mining practices to ensure a robust domestic EV supply chain.

items.title: Altmin's lithium project joins MSP for India
items.summary:
- Altmin becomes the first Indian company listed under the **Mineral Security Partnership (MSP)**, signaling **India**'s push to secure **critical minerals**.
- Altmin has acquired a unique **lithium refining technology** in **Brazil** and plans to set up refineries closer to **India**.
- The listing aims to reduce **India's dependence on China** for refining and bolster **Make in India** & EV battery supply chains.

items.title: China clampdown spurs EVs to shift to rare-earth-free motors
items.summary:
- In Faridabad, Sterling Gtake E-Mobility is testing *rare-earth-free motors* to cut India’s reliance on China for critical minerals.
- Startups like **Chara Technologies** and **Sona Comstar** race to magnet-free or ferrite-magnet motors; Conifer targets 70,000 units annually.
- Government incentives and partnerships with Japan and Korea aim to scale production within a year after China’s export curbs.

items.title: Rajasthan mining and petroleum growth poised
items.author: Mahima Jain
items.summary:
- Rajasthan has *82 minerals*, with *58 commercially exploited*—the most in India—and policies like *Mineral Policy 2024*, *M-SAN Policy 2024*, and *CGD Policy 2025* to simplify procedures.
- At the Rising Rajasthan Investment Summit, over 300 MoUs were signed worth more than ₹1 lakh crore, in *Petroleum*, *Mining*, and *CNG*, with reforms to ease doing business.
- *AI/ML* pilots with IITs to map minerals and exploit dumps, and *CGD* expansion to broaden household connections and downstream processing for energy security.

items.title: Rana Group starts smart hub in Ras Al Khaimah
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Rana Group* has begun construction of the *Erisha Smart Manufacturing Hub* at *RAKEZ* in Ras Al Khaimah, UAE, with a foundation stone ceremony.
- The hub will span about 335 acres and cover 15 million sq ft built, 25 million sq ft total, to support 150+ industries including *electric and hydrogen vehicles*, *renewable energy*, *eVTOL aircraft* and *semiconductors*.
- It is expected to attract around $10 billion in investment, add roughly $5–6 billion to UAE GDP and create about 4,000 jobs, while serving as a base for *Erisha E Mobility*, signaling a move toward *green energy* and *sustainable industrialisation*.

items.title: SmartSoC-Cortus tie-up for secure chip design in India
items.summary:
- *SmartSoC Solutions* and **Cortus S.A.S.** partner to develop and manufacture secure chips for SIM cards, smart cards, banking cards and e-passports in India. 
- The alliance aims to build secure, *self-reliant* chip design and production capacity in India using Cortus IP and SmartSoC's engineering. 
- India’s push for domestic semiconductor manufacturing under the PLI scheme and secure digital identity infrastructure underpins the deal.

items.title: CNH plans new India plant to reach double digit tractor share
Lumax to open China office this year
items.summary:
- Lumax will open its first China office this year as a group resource centre to access advanced *auto-electronics* trends and improve sourcing/tech scouting.
- The move to a *Tier 0.5* model means end-to-end bundles and co‑development with OEMs, backed by a Bengaluru software hub (*SHIFT*) to integrate software with vehicle architecture.
- Mega plants and a reoriented supply chain signal a shift from component supply to *systems integration*, while India remains the growth focus and engineers shift to electronics/software.

items.title: Novartis to acquire Tourmaline Bio for $1.4 billion
Indian pharma: price hikes, IP transfers to curb tariffs
items.summary:
- The Indian pharma sector needs *price hikes*, *site transfers*, and *IP transfers* to counter ongoing US tariff uncertainty, per Systematix Research.
- Tariff uncertainty persists with cautious US capacity expansion; raw material prices are correcting in antibiotics and generic API prices have stabilized, while **GLP-1** opportunities and CDMO demand rise.
- 1QFY26 was weak for many players, with US margins eroded, but *Sun Pharma* and *Pfizer* posted strength even as *Orchid Pharma*, *Dr Reddy's* and *Piramal* faced pressure, signaling near-term challenges but long-term growth prospects.

items.title: Goyal urges exporters to prioritise local supply chains
items.summary:
- Goyal urged exporters to prioritise *local supply chains* to strengthen *economic security* amid global trade uncertainties.
- He linked the push to **Atmanirbhar Bharat**, urged passing *GST relief* to consumers to boost *domestic demand* and growth, and highlighted government support against rising tariffs.
- He called for upgrading *product quality*, diversifying *supply chains*, adopting new technologies and *sustainable practices*, with the government backing a favorable ecosystem for exporters.

items.title: Uni Abex to double high-performance alloys capacity
items.summary:
- **Uni Abex Alloy Products Ltd** will invest over ₹100 crore to double its production capacity from 6,000 to 12,000 metric tonnes per annum of *high-performance alloys* by FY2025-26 at its Dharwad, Karnataka facility.
- The *brownfield expansion* adds one new dedicated manufacturing line, bringing capacity to two specialised lines to meet rising demand from iron & steel, petrochemicals, fertilisers, aerospace, energy, automotive and medical sectors.
- The move is backed by the **Neterwala Group**, with *Kuldeep Bhan* (Group President - Global Metallurgy) saying the investment aligns with government-led growth in these sectors.

items.title: QCY to set up manufacturing in Haryana, India
items.summary:
- *QCY* announced entry into India's market with plans to set up a manufacturing facility in Manesar, Haryana, and partner with *WooDoo Ventures Private Limited* for marketing and distribution.
- The company targets a **$75-100 million** value share by 2026 under the **Make in India** initiative, with India's wearable tech market growing from *$1.3B* in 2024 to *$1.5B* by 2026.
- It will launch six flagship products across *TWS*, headphones, and speakers, backed by collaborations with **Qualcomm** and a sizable global manufacturing footprint.

items.title: Incentive scheme in works for construction gear
items.summary:
- The Centre is finalising a ₹14,000-16,000 crore incentive scheme to promote local production of key construction gear, including *tunnel boring machines (TBMs)* and cranes, with inter-ministerial consultations underway.
- Indigenisation could rise to **70-80%** in 5–7 years, cutting imports from abroad and potentially saving about **$3 billion** in forex annually.
- A dedicated **Production-Linked Incentive (PLI)** scheme for EPC machinery and stronger **Make in India** procurement could boost project planning, but domestic capacity readiness remains a hurdle.

items.title: FCC moves to bar some Chinese labs from testing
items.summary:
- **FCC** begins withdrawing recognition from seven *Chinese labs* due to *national security* concerns and bars them from testing U.S. electronics.
- The FCC notes about 75% of electronics are tested in labs in *China*, with four labs' recognition expired since May.
- FCC Chairman Brendan Carr warns that foreign adversary governments should not own or control the labs certifying devices for the U.S. market.

items.title: Netskope eyeing up to $6.5B valuation in US IPO
items.summary:
- Netskope seeks a valuation of up to **$6.5 billion** in its U.S. IPO, selling 47.8 million shares at **$15–$17** to raise up to **$813 million**.
- The Santa Clara-based company provides **cloud security software** for apps, websites and data, with customers including **Qualcomm** and **BMO**.
- **Morgan Stanley** and **J.P. Morgan** lead the underwriting, with Netskope listing on Nasdaq under the ticker **NTSK**.

items.title: Haryana to become hub of drone technology, says Haryana CM
items.summary: - Haryana aims to become a hub of *drone technology*, with the first drone manufacturing hub at Sisai village in Hisar—the largest in South Asia.\n- CM Nayab Singh Saini announced a roadmap for *Viksit Haryana* to realise PM Modi's *Viksit Bharat* by 2047, noting 252 pilots and 136 technicians certified by DGCA (including 53 women).\n- Drones will empower rural communities through schemes like *Namo Drone Didi* and *Kisan Drone*, boosting agriculture and employment.

items.title: Bharat Forge plans defence complex for missiles, space launch vehicles; shares gain over 5%
Vedanta invests over ₹12,500 crore in metal manufacturing for EV sector
Gautam Solar to invest ₹4000 crore to set up 5 GW solar cell manufacturing plant in Madhya Pradesh
RRP Electronics signs four strategic MoUs at Semicon India 2025 to enhance India's semiconductor ecosystem
Yudh Abhyas 2025: Indian, US soldiers conduct live drills in Alaska to boost defence ties
India seeks Pakistan clash insights to woo arms buyers
items.summary:
- The May clash showcased *India's new warfare vision*, including the domestically built *invisible shield* missile defence system, aimed at fuelling overseas demand.
- Defence exports hit a record $2.8B in 2024–25 and domestic production rose to about $18B, signaling a shift to major weapons exporting.
- Analysts call the conflict a *market demonstrator*, with BrahMos missiles drawing interest from many countries despite export and geopolitical challenges.
